H0.text: Thermometer is the most useful tool for observing the details of an insect's wings.

H1.text: Balance is the most useful tool for observing the details of an insect's wings.

H2.text: A hand lens is the tool most useful for observing the details of an insect's wings.

H3.text: A graduated cylinder is the tool most useful for observing the details of an insect's wings.

A4.text: Magnifying glasses typically have low magnifying power: 2×–6×, with lower magnification providing a wider lens and larger field of view.

A5.text: A magnifying glass is a convex lens—usually mounted in a frame with a handle—that is used to produce a magnified image of an object.
